title: Rugby World Cup: Wales barely beat Fiji
description: Wales struggled to win over Fiji 32-26 in the latest installment of their entertaining Rugby World Cup rivalry on Sunday.

title: Rugby World Cup: South Africa wins over Scotland 18-3
description: South Africa is looking to win a record fourth title and become just the second team to retain the World Cup.

title: Football: Rubiales says he will resign over kiss scandal
description: Suspended Spanish federation president sparked a worldwide backlash after forcibly kissing midfielder Jenni Hermoso following Spain's World Cup win on August 20.

title: In Morocco, rescuers look for survivors in rubble after quake kills over 2,100
description: Friday's 6.8-magnitude quake wiped out entire villages in the hills of the Atlas mountains.On Sunday an aftershock of magnitude 4.5 rattled the same region.

title: Sweat, a scent of hand-to-hand combat
description: This summer, columnist Maïa Mazaurette embarks on an adventure like no other as she steers her vessel through the currents of sexuality's fluids.

title: Jean-Pierre Lambert, a farmer who took on the French 'system' and lost everything
description: Lambert has been battling the powerful Mutualité Sociale Agricole insurance since 2005. At 66, he is now completely ruined. His story tells of the bleak future of those who refuse to play by the rules of agribusiness.

title: Morocco earthquake: 'It's occurrence in this region was no surprise'
description: Robin Lacassin, a geologist and tectonist, analyzes the seismic vulnerability of the Al Haouz province, southwest of the city of Marrakech, where the epicenter of the tremor that killed thousands is located.

title: G20: Ukraine's allies climbdown on Russian invasion statement as Russia hails a 'success'
description: After days of negotiation, the West, anxious not to choose between Moscow and Kyiv, had to accept a compromise that did not condemn Russia and gave pride of place to the positions of emerging countries.

title: Germany beat Serbia to win Basketball World Cup
description: Serbia launched a furious fourth-quarter fightback but Germany managed to hold them off and put their name on the Naismith Trophy.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Double whammy of sports and economic crises leave Wales in the doldrums
description: Even though they were semi-finalists at the last World Cup, the Welsh team is experiencing a serious slump as it starts  its World Cup against Fiji  on Sunday.

title: Mobilizing the Tartars to liberate Ukraine
description: The appointment of a Crimean Tatar to the Ministry of Defense illustrates the prominent role played by this Muslim minority in the defense of Ukraine.

title: Orban wants to turn Hungary into a 'major battery powerhouse'
description: Some 30 factories are expected to make the country one of the world leaders in electric car batteries by 2030. Local residents are worried about the consequences of this rapid industrialization.

title: In Haute-Savoie, a village resigns itself to closing its ski resort for good
description: On September 15, the chairlift at the La Sambuy Seythenex resort in southeastern France will stop running, following a municipal decision. Residents and tourism professionals are having trouble accepting the fact.

title: Canada target Olympic success after first Basketball World Cup bronze
description: After 87 years of waiting, Canada has again medaled on one of basketball's biggest stages.

title: G20 summit ends with India, Brazil and Russia boasting success
description: Kyiv said the G20 had 'nothing to be proud of' after G20 members shied away from direct criticism of Russia.

title: Marrakech residents fear aftershocks, and tourists fleeing the country
description: Many French people own accommodation that they rent out to tourists. They are trying to reassure their clientele and prevent travelers from turning away from a destination that was returning to pre-Covid levels.

title: Russian strikes on Ukraine kill 2 foreign aid workers, target Kyiv in new wave of overnight drone attacks
description: Foreign aid volunteers working for an NGO were reportedly killed on Sunday after Russia launched a new barrage of overnight drone attacks on Ukraine's capital.

title: Rugby World Cup: George Ford steers 14-man England to victory against Argentina
description: Ford scored all 27 of England's points, leaving the Argentinian Pumas far behind with just 10. This success was achieved with fourteen players following Tom Curry's red card.

title: Morocco earthquake: Near the epicenter in Amizmiz, 'no one has come to help us yet'
description: In this small town in the Al Haouz province, with a population of some 20,000, most homes bear the scars of the earthquake as residents begin to mourn the over 2,000 people who died.

title: Paris 2024: Russians and Belarusians put neutrality to the test
description: Athletes from Russia and Belarus have still not been officially invited to next year's Olympic Games. At the heart of the issue is the question: Can these athletes ever be truly neutral?

title: 'Golden boy' Stefanos Kasselakis wants to commit to the Greek left
description: The former Goldman Sachs banker has put forward his candidacy to succeed Alexis Tsipras, president of the Syriza party, which embodied the opposition to the austerity policies imposed on Athens during the financial crisis.

title: Chinese automakers are omnipresent at the Munich Motor Show
description: Whether they are manufacturers or suppliers, over 40% of the companies represented at the German Motor Show in Munich from September 5 to 10 are Chinese.

title: In northeastern Syria, Arab tribes rebel against the domination of Kurdish forces
description: Challenged for their authoritarian management of the province of Deir ez-Zor, the Kurdish-dominated Syrian Democratic Forces regained control of several villages after 10 days of deadly clashes.

title: Rugby World Cup: Australia ends losing run at Georgia's expense
description: Australia earned its first win this year by 35-15 against Georgia at the Rugby World Cup on Saturday.

title: US: Phoenix breaks another heat record with 54 days over 110°F in 2023
description: An extreme heat warning remained in effect, with temperatures forecast at 111°F (43.9°C) on Sunday and 106°F (41.1°C) on Monday.

title: Climate: With its Global Stocktake, the UN sends a warning shot before COP28
description: In this document taking stock of the measures taken by states since the ratification of the Paris Agreement in 2015, international experts believe that 'the world is not on track to meet the long-term goals.'
